access_token.description: The [personal access token](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/account-security/api-access-tokens#personal-tokens) or [service token](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/account-security/api-access-tokens#service-tokens) used to authenticate with LaunchDarkly. You can also set this with the `LAUNCHDARKLY_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment variable. You must provide either `access_token` or `oauth_token`.

api_host.description: The LaunchDarkly host address. If this argument is not specified, the default host address is `https://app.launchdarkly.com`

http_timeout.description: The HTTP timeout (in seconds) when making API calls to LaunchDarkly.

oauth_token.description: An OAuth V2 token you use to authenticate with LaunchDarkly. You can also set this with the `LAUNCHDARKLY_OAUTH_TOKEN` environment variable. You must provide either `access_token` or `oauth_token`.

custom_roles.description: A list of custom role IDs to use as access limits for the access token.

default_api_version.description: The default API version for this token. Defaults to the latest API version. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing token in state and the creation of a new one.

expire.description: An expiration time for the current token secret, expressed as a Unix epoch time. Replace the computed token secret with a new value. The expired secret will no longer be able to authorize usage of the LaunchDarkly API. This field argument is **deprecated**. Please update your config to remove `expire` to maintain compatibility with future versions

name.description: A human-friendly name for the access token.

role.description: A built-in LaunchDarkly role. Can be `reader`, `writer`, or `admin`

service_token.description: Whether the token will be a [service token](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/account-security/api-access-tokens#service-tokens). A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing token and the creation of a new one.

token.description: The access token used to authorize usage of the LaunchDarkly API.

actions.description:
The list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement applies.
Either `actions` or `not_actions` must be specified. For a list of available actions read [Actions reference](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/account-security/custom-roles/actions#actions-reference).

effect.description: Either `allow` or `deny`. This argument defines whether the statement allows or denies access to the named resources and actions.

not_actions.description: The list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement does not apply.

not_resources.description: The list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement does not apply.

resources.description: The list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement applies.

block.description: Define inline custom roles. An array of statements represented as config blocks with three attributes: effect, resources, actions. May be used in place of a built-in or custom role. [Using polices](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/members/role-policies). May be specified more than once.

actions.description:
The list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement applies.
Either `actions` or `not_actions` must be specified. For a list of available actions read [Actions reference](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/account-security/custom-roles/actions#actions-reference).

effect.description: Either `allow` or `deny`. This argument defines whether the statement allows or denies access to the named resources and actions.

not_actions.description: The list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement does not apply.

not_resources.description: The list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement does not apply.

resources.description: The list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement applies.

block.description: Define inline custom roles. An array of statements represented as config blocks with three attributes: effect, resources, actions. May be used in place of a built-in or custom role. May be specified more than once. This field argument is **deprecated**. Update your config to use `inline_role` to maintain compatibility with future versions.

Provides a LaunchDarkly access token resource.

This resource allows you to create and manage access tokens within your LaunchDarkly organization.

-> **Note:** This resource will store the full plaintext secret for your access token in Terraform state. Be sure your state is configured securely before using this resource. See https://www.terraform.io/docs/state/sensitive-data.html for more details.

The resource must contain either a "role", "custom_role" or an "inline_roles" (previously "policy_statements") block. As of v1.7.0, "policy_statements" has been deprecated in favor of "inline_roles".

config.description: The set of configuration fields corresponding to the value defined for `integration_key`. Refer to the `formVariables` field in the corresponding `integrations/<integration_key>/manifest.json` file in [this repo](https://github.com/launchdarkly/integration-framework/tree/master/integrations) for a full list of fields for the integration you wish to configure. **IMPORTANT**: Please note that Terraform will only accept these in snake case, regardless of the case shown in the manifest.

integration_key.description: The integration key. Supported integration keys are `cloudtrail`, `datadog`, `dynatrace`, `elastic`, `grafana`, `honeycomb`, `logdna`, `msteams`, `new-relic-apm`, `signalfx`, `slack`, and `splunk`. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing resource and the creation of a new one.

name.description: A human-friendly name for your audit log subscription viewable from within the LaunchDarkly Integrations page.

on.description: Whether or not you want your subscription enabled, i.e. to actively send events.

actions.description:
The list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement applies.
Either `actions` or `not_actions` must be specified. For a list of available actions read [Actions reference](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/account-security/custom-roles/actions#actions-reference).

effect.description: Either `allow` or `deny`. This argument defines whether the statement allows or denies access to the named resources and actions.

not_actions.description: The list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement does not apply.

not_resources.description: The list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement does not apply.

resources.description: The list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement applies.

block.description: A block representing the resources to which you wish to subscribe.

Provides a LaunchDarkly audit log subscription resource.

This resource allows you to create and manage LaunchDarkly audit log subscriptions.

base_permissions.description: The base permission level - either reader or no_access. Defaults to reader

key.description: A unique key that will be used to reference the custom role in your code

name.description: A name for the custom role

actions.description:
The list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement applies.
Either `actions` or `not_actions` must be specified. For a list of available actions read [Actions reference](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/account-security/custom-roles/actions#actions-reference).

effect.description: Either `allow` or `deny`. This argument defines whether the statement allows or denies access to the named resources and actions.

not_actions.description: The list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement does not apply.

not_resources.description: The list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement does not apply.

resources.description: The list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement applies.

block.description:
Provides a LaunchDarkly custom role resource.

-> **Note:** Custom roles are available to customers on an Enterprise LaunchDarkly plan. To learn more, read about our pricing. To upgrade your plan, [contact LaunchDarkly Sales](https://launchdarkly.com/contact-sales/).

This resource allows you to create and manage custom roles within your LaunchDarkly organization.

config.description: The destination-specific configuration. To learn more, read [Destination-Specific Configs](#destination-specific-configs)

env_key.description: The environment key. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing resource and the creation of a new one.

kind.description: The data export destination type. Available choices are `kinesis`, `google-pubsub`, `mparticle`, `azure-event-hubs`, and `segment`. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing resource and the creation of a new one.

name.description: A human-readable name for your data export destination.

on.description: Whether the data export destination is on or not.

project_key.description: The LaunchDarkly project key. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing resource and the creation of a new one.

block.description:
Provides a LaunchDarkly Data Export Destination resource.

-> **Note:** Data Export is available to customers on an Enterprise LaunchDarkly plan. To learn more, read about our pricing. To upgrade your plan, [contact LaunchDarkly Sales](https://launchdarkly.com/contact-sales/).

Data Export Destinations are locations that receive exported data. This resource allows you to configure destinations for the export of raw analytics data, including feature flag requests, analytics events, custom events, and more.

To learn more about data export, read [Data Export Documentation](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/integrations/data-export).

color.description: The color swatch as an RGB hex value with no leading `#`. For example: `000000`

confirm_changes.description: Set to `true` if this environment requires confirmation for flag and segment changes. This field will default to `false` when not set.

default_track_events.description: Set to `true` to enable data export for every flag created in this environment after you configure this argument. This field will default to `false` when not set. To learn more, read [Data Export](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/data-export).

default_ttl.description: The TTL for the environment. This must be between 0 and 60 minutes. The TTL setting only applies to environments using the PHP SDK. This field will default to `0` when not set. To learn more, read [TTL settings](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/organize/environments#ttl-settings).

key.description: The project-unique key for the environment. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing resource and the creation of a new one.

name.description: The name of the environment.

require_comments.description: Set to `true` if this environment requires comments for flag and segment changes. This field will default to `false` when not set.

secure_mode.description: Set to `true` to ensure a user of the client-side SDK cannot impersonate another user. This field will default to `false` when not set.

can_apply_declined_changes.description: Set to `true` if changes can be applied as long as the `min_num_approvals` is met, regardless of whether any reviewers have declined a request. Defaults to `true`.

can_review_own_request.description: Set to `true` if requesters can approve or decline their own request. They may always comment. Defaults to `false`.

min_num_approvals.description: The number of approvals required before an approval request can be applied. This number must be between 1 and 5. Defaults to 1.

required.description: Set to `true` for changes to flags in this environment to require approval. You may only set `required` to true if `required_approval_tags` is not set and vice versa. Defaults to `false`.

required_approval_tags.description: An array of tags used to specify which flags with those tags require approval. You may only set `required_approval_tags` if `required` is not set to `true` and vice versa.

service_config.description:
The configuration for the service associated with this approval. This is specific to each approval service. For a `service_kind` of `servicenow`, the following fields apply:

	 - `template` (String) The sys_id of the Standard Change Request Template in ServiceNow that LaunchDarkly will use when creating the change request.
	 - `detail_column` (String) The name of the ServiceNow Change Request column LaunchDarkly uses to populate detailed approval request information.

service_kind.description: The kind of service associated with this approval. This determines which platform is used for requesting approval. Valid values are `servicenow`, `launchdarkly`.

block.description:
Provides a LaunchDarkly environment resource.

This resource allows you to create and manage environments in your LaunchDarkly organization. This resource should _not_ be used if the encapsulated project is also managed via Terraform. In this case, you should _always_ use the nested environments config blocks on your `launchdarkly_project` resource to manage your environments.

-> **Note:** Mixing the use of nested `environments` blocks in the [`launchdarkly_project`] resource and `launchdarkly_environment` resources is not recommended.

archived.description: Specifies whether the flag is archived or not. Note that you cannot create a new flag that is archived, but can update a flag to be archived.

include_in_snippet.description: Specifies whether this flag should be made available to the client-side JavaScript SDK using the client-side Id. This value gets its default from your project configuration if not set. `include_in_snippet` is now deprecated. Please migrate to `client_side_availability.using_environment_id` to maintain future compatibility.

key.description: The unique feature flag key that references the flag in your application code. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing resource and the creation of a new one.

maintainer_id.description: The feature flag maintainer's 24 character alphanumeric team member ID. If not set, it will automatically be or stay set to the member ID associated with the API key used by your LaunchDarkly Terraform provider or the most recently-set maintainer.

name.description: The human-readable name of the feature flag.

project_key.description: The feature flag's project key. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing resource and the creation of a new one.

temporary.description: Specifies whether the flag is a temporary flag.

variation_type.description: The feature flag's variation type: `boolean`, `string`, `number` or `json`.

using_environment_id.description: Whether this flag is available to SDKs using the client-side ID.

using_mobile_key.description: Whether this flag is available to SDKs using a mobile key.

name.description: The name of the custom property.

value.description: The list of custom property value strings.

block.description: List of nested blocks describing the feature flag's [custom properties](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/connecting/custom-properties)

off_variation.description: The index of the variation the flag will default to in all new environments when off.

on_variation.description: The index of the variation the flag will default to in all new environments when on.

block.description: A block containing the indices of the variations to be used as the default on and off variations in all new environments. Flag configurations in existing environments will not be changed nor updated if the configuration block is removed.

name.description: The name of the variation.

value.description:
The variation value. The value's type must correspond to the `variation_type` argument. For example: `variation_type = "boolean"` accepts only `true` or `false`. The `number` variation type accepts both floats and ints, but please note that any trailing zeroes on floats will be trimmed (i.e. `1.1` and `1.100` will both be converted to `1.1`).

If you wish to define an empty string variation, you must still define the value field on the variations block like so:

```terraform
variations {
  value = ""
}
```

block.description: An array of possible variations for the flag

Provides a LaunchDarkly feature flag resource.

This resource allows you to create and manage feature flags within your LaunchDarkly organization.

env_key.description: The environment key. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing resource and the creation of a new one.

flag_id.description: The feature flag's unique `id` in the format `project_key/flag_key`. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing resource and the creation of a new one.

off_variation.description: The index of the variation to serve if targeting is disabled.

on.description: Whether targeting is enabled. Defaults to `false` if not set.

track_events.description: Whether to send event data back to LaunchDarkly. Defaults to `false` if not set.

context_kind.description: The context kind on which the flag should target in this environment. User (`user`) targets should be specified as `targets` attribute blocks.

variation.description: The index of the variation to serve if a user target value is matched.

block.description: The set of nested blocks describing the individual targets for non-user context kinds for each variation.

bucket_by.description: Group percentage rollout by a custom attribute. This argument is only valid if rollout_weights is also specified.

context_kind.description: The context kind associated with the specified rollout. This argument is only valid if rollout_weights is also specified. If omitted, defaults to `user`.

rollout_weights.description: List of integer percentage rollout weights (in thousandths of a percent) to apply to each variation if the rule clauses evaluates to `true`. The sum of the `rollout_weights` must equal 100000 and the number of rollout weights specified in the array must match the number of flag variations. You must specify either `variation` or `rollout_weights`.

variation.description: The default integer variation index to serve if no `prerequisites`, `target`, or `rules` apply. You must specify either `variation` or `rollout_weights`.

block.description: Nested block describing the default variation to serve if no `prerequisites`, `target`, or `rules` apply.

variation.description: The index of the prerequisite feature flag's variation to target.

block.description: List of nested blocks describing prerequisite feature flags rules.

bucket_by.description: Group percentage rollout by a custom attribute. This argument is only valid if `rollout_weights` is also specified.

description.description: A human-readable description of the targeting rule.

rollout_weights.description: List of integer percentage rollout weights (in thousandths of a percent) to apply to each variation if the rule clauses evaluates to `true`. The sum of the `rollout_weights` must equal 100000 and the number of rollout weights specified in the array must match the number of flag variations. You must specify either `variation` or `rollout_weights`.

variation.description: The integer variation index to serve if the rule clauses evaluate to `true`. You must specify either `variation` or `rollout_weights`

attribute.description: The user attribute to operate on

context_kind.description: The context kind associated with this rule clause. This argument is only valid if `rollout_weights` is also specified. If omitted, defaults to `user`.

negate.description: Whether to negate the rule clause.

op.description: The operator associated with the rule clause. Available options are `in`, `endsWith`, `startsWith`, `matches`, `contains`, `lessThan`, `lessThanOrEqual`, `greaterThanOrEqual`, `before`, `after`, `segmentMatch`, `semVerEqual`, `semVerLessThan`, and `semVerGreaterThan`.

value_type.description: The type for each of the clause's values. Available types are `boolean`, `string`, and `number`. If omitted, `value_type` defaults to `string`.

values.description: The list of values associated with the rule clause.

block.description: List of nested blocks specifying the logical clauses to evaluate
List of logical targeting rules.

variation.description: The index of the variation to serve if a user target value is matched.

block.description: Set of nested blocks describing the individual user targets for each variation.

Provides a LaunchDarkly environment-specific feature flag resource.

This resource allows you to create and manage environment-specific feature flags attributes within your LaunchDarkly organization.

-> **Note:** If you intend to attach a feature flag to any experiments, we do _not_ recommend configuring environment-specific flag settings using Terraform. Subsequent applies may overwrite the changes made by experiments and break your experiment. An alternate workaround is to use the [lifecycle.ignore_changes](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/meta-arguments/lifecycle#ignore_changes) Terraform meta-argument on the `fallthrough` field to prevent potential overwrites.

enabled.description: Whether the trigger is currently active or not. This property defaults to true upon creation

flag_key.description: The key of the feature flag the trigger acts upon

integration_key.description: The unique identifier of the integration you intend to set your trigger up with. "generic-trigger" should be used for integrations not explicitly supported.

maintainer_id.description: The LaunchDarkly ID of the member who maintains the trigger. The API will automatically apply the member associated with your Terraform API key or the most recently-set maintainer

kind.description: The action to perform when triggering. Currently supported flag actions are "turnFlagOn" and "turnFlagOff".

block.description: Instructions containing the action to perform when triggering. Currently supported flag actions are "turnFlagOn" and "turnFlagOff".

description.description: A short description of what the metric will be used for

event_key.description: The event key for your metric (if custom metric)

key.description: A unique key that will be used to reference the metric in your code

kind.description: The metric type -available choices are 'pageview', 'click', and 'custom'

maintainer_id.description: The LaunchDarkly ID of the user who will maintain the metric. If not set, the API will automatically apply the member associated with your Terraform API key or the most recently-set maintainer

name.description: A human-readable name for your metric

randomization_units.description: A set of one or more context kinds that this metric can measure events from.

selector.description: The CSS selector for your metric (if click metric)

success_criteria.description: The success criteria for your metric (if numeric metric)

unit.description: The unit for your metric (if numeric metric)

kind.description: The url type - available choices are 'exact', 'canonical', 'substring' and 'regex'

block.description: List of nested `url` blocks describing URLs that you want to track the metric on

include_in_snippet.description: Whether feature flags created under the project should be available to client-side SDKs by default

name.description: A human-readable name for your project

block.description: List determining which SDKs have access to new flags created under the project by default

color.description: The color swatch as an RGB hex value with no leading `#`. For example: `000000`

confirm_changes.description: Set to `true` if this environment requires confirmation for flag and segment changes. This field will default to `false` when not set.

default_track_events.description: Set to `true` to enable data export for every flag created in this environment after you configure this argument. This field will default to `false` when not set. To learn more, read [Data Export](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/data-export).

default_ttl.description: The TTL for the environment. This must be between 0 and 60 minutes. The TTL setting only applies to environments using the PHP SDK. This field will default to `0` when not set. To learn more, read [TTL settings](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/organize/environments#ttl-settings).

key.description: The project-unique key for the environment. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing resource and the creation of a new one.

name.description: The name of the environment.

require_comments.description: Set to `true` if this environment requires comments for flag and segment changes. This field will default to `false` when not set.

secure_mode.description: Set to `true` to ensure a user of the client-side SDK cannot impersonate another user. This field will default to `false` when not set.

can_apply_declined_changes.description: Set to `true` if changes can be applied as long as the `min_num_approvals` is met, regardless of whether any reviewers have declined a request. Defaults to `true`.

can_review_own_request.description: Set to `true` if requesters can approve or decline their own request. They may always comment. Defaults to `false`.

min_num_approvals.description: The number of approvals required before an approval request can be applied. This number must be between 1 and 5. Defaults to 1.

required.description: Set to `true` for changes to flags in this environment to require approval. You may only set `required` to true if `required_approval_tags` is not set and vice versa. Defaults to `false`.

required_approval_tags.description: An array of tags used to specify which flags with those tags require approval. You may only set `required_approval_tags` if `required` is not set to `true` and vice versa.

service_config.description:
The configuration for the service associated with this approval. This is specific to each approval service. For a `service_kind` of `servicenow`, the following fields apply:

	 - `template` (String) The sys_id of the Standard Change Request Template in ServiceNow that LaunchDarkly will use when creating the change request.
	 - `detail_column` (String) The name of the ServiceNow Change Request column LaunchDarkly uses to populate detailed approval request information.

service_kind.description: The kind of service associated with this approval. This determines which platform is used for requesting approval. Valid values are `servicenow`, `launchdarkly`.

block.description: List of nested `environments` blocks describing LaunchDarkly environments that belong to the project

display_key.description: The last four characters of the full_key.

full_key.description: The unique key assigned to the Relay Proxy configuration during creation.

name.description: A human-friendly name for the Relay Proxy configuration

actions.description:
The list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement applies.
Either `actions` or `not_actions` must be specified. For a list of available actions read [Actions reference](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/account-security/custom-roles/actions#actions-reference).

effect.description: Either `allow` or `deny`. This argument defines whether the statement allows or denies access to the named resources and actions.

not_actions.description: The list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement does not apply.

not_resources.description: The list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement does not apply.

resources.description: The list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement applies.

creation_date.description: The segment's creation date represented as a UNIX epoch timestamp.

description.description: The description of the segment's purpose.

env_key.description: The segment's environment key. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing resource and the creation of a new one.

excluded.description: List of user keys excluded from the segment. To target on other context kinds, use the excluded_contexts block attribute. This attribute is not valid when `unbounded` is set to `true`.

included.description: List of user keys included in the segment. To target on other context kinds, use the included_contexts block attribute. This attribute is not valid when `unbounded` is set to `true`.

key.description: The unique key that references the segment. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing resource and the creation of a new one.

name.description: The human-friendly name for the segment.

project_key.description: The segment's project key. A change in this field will force the destruction of the existing resource and the creation of a new one.

unbounded.description: Whether to create a standard segment (`false`) or a Big Segment (`true`). Standard segments include rule-based and smaller list-based segments. Big Segments include larger list-based segments and synced segments. Only use a Big Segment if you need to add more than 15,000 individual targets. It is not possible to manage the list of targeted contexts for Big Segments with Terraform.

unbounded_context_kind.description: For Big Segments, the targeted context kind. If this attribute is not specified it will default to `user`.

context_kind.description: The context kind associated with this segment target. To target on user contexts, use the included and excluded attributes.

values.description: List of target object keys included in or excluded from the segment.

block.description: List of non-user target objects excluded from the segment. This attribute is not valid when `unbounded` is set to `true`.

context_kind.description: The context kind associated with this segment target. To target on user contexts, use the included and excluded attributes.

values.description: List of target object keys included in or excluded from the segment.

block.description: List of non-user target objects included in the segment. This attribute is not valid when `unbounded` is set to `true`.

bucket_by.description: The attribute by which to group users together.

rollout_context_kind.description: The context kind associated with this segment rule. This argument is only valid if weight is also specified. If omitted, defaults to 'user'

weight.description: The integer weight of the rule (between 1 and 100000).

attribute.description: The user attribute to operate on

context_kind.description: The context kind associated with this rule clause. This argument is only valid if `rollout_weights` is also specified. If omitted, defaults to `user`.

negate.description: Whether to negate the rule clause.

op.description: The operator associated with the rule clause. Available options are `in`, `endsWith`, `startsWith`, `matches`, `contains`, `lessThan`, `lessThanOrEqual`, `greaterThanOrEqual`, `before`, `after`, `segmentMatch`, `semVerEqual`, `semVerLessThan`, and `semVerGreaterThan`.

value_type.description: The type for each of the clause's values. Available types are `boolean`, `string`, and `number`. If omitted, `value_type` defaults to `string`.

values.description: The list of values associated with the rule clause.

block.description: List of nested blocks specifying the logical clauses to evaluate
List of nested custom rule blocks to apply to the segment. This attribute is not valid when `unbounded` is set to `true`.

Provides a LaunchDarkly segment resource.

This resource allows you to create and manage segments within your LaunchDarkly organization.

custom_role_keys.description: A list of custom role keys for the team

maintainers.description: A list of team maintainer IDs as strings

member_ids.description: A list of team member IDs as strings

name.description: The team's human-readable name

custom_roles.description: IDs or keys of custom roles. Team members must have either a role or custom role

role.description: The team member's role. This must be reader, writer, admin, or no_access. Team members must have either a role or custom role

custom_role_keys.description: A set of custom role keys to assign to the team.

block.description: Manages the mapping of LaunchDarkly custom roles to teams.

name.description: A human-readable name for your webhook

on.description: Whether this webhook is enabled or not

secret.description: If sign is true, and the secret attribute is omitted, LaunchDarkly will automatically generate a secret for you

url.description: The URL of the remote webhook

actions.description:
The list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement applies.
Either `actions` or `not_actions` must be specified. For a list of available actions read [Actions reference](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/account-security/custom-roles/actions#actions-reference).

effect.description: Either `allow` or `deny`. This argument defines whether the statement allows or denies access to the named resources and actions.

not_actions.description: The list of action specifiers defining the actions to which the statement does not apply.

not_resources.description: The list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement does not apply.

resources.description: The list of resource specifiers defining the resources to which the statement applies.

config.description: The set of configuration fields corresponding to the value defined for `integration_key`. Refer to the `formVariables` field in the corresponding `integrations/<integration_key>/manifest.json` file in [this repo](https://github.com/launchdarkly/integration-framework/tree/master/integrations) for a full list of fields for the integration you wish to configure. **IMPORTANT**: Please note that Terraform will only accept these in snake case, regardless of the case shown in the manifest.

integration_key.description: The integration key. Supported integration keys are `cloudtrail`, `datadog`, `dynatrace`, `elastic`, `grafana`, `honeycomb`, `logdna`, `msteams`, `new-relic-apm`, `signalfx`, `slack`, and `splunk`.

name.description: A human-friendly name for your audit log subscription viewable from within the LaunchDarkly Integrations page.

on.description: Whether or not you want your subscription enabled, i.e. to actively send events.

statements.description: A block representing the resources to which you wish to subscribe.

block.description:
Provides a LaunchDarkly audit log subscription data source.

This data source allows you to retrieve information about LaunchDarkly audit log subscriptions.

confirm_changes.description: Set to `true` if this environment requires confirmation for flag and segment changes. This field will default to `false` when not set.

default_track_events.description: Set to `true` to enable data export for every flag created in this environment after you configure this argument. This field will default to `false` when not set. To learn more, read [Data Export](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/data-export).

default_ttl.description: The TTL for the environment. This must be between 0 and 60 minutes. The TTL setting only applies to environments using the PHP SDK. This field will default to `0` when not set. To learn more, read [TTL settings](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/organize/environments#ttl-settings).

key.description: The project-unique key for the environment.

require_comments.description: Set to `true` if this environment requires comments for flag and segment changes. This field will default to `false` when not set.

secure_mode.description: Set to `true` to ensure a user of the client-side SDK cannot impersonate another user. This field will default to `false` when not set.

block.description:
Provides a LaunchDarkly environment data source.

This data source allows you to retrieve environment information from your LaunchDarkly organization.

archived.description: Specifies whether the flag is archived or not. Note that you cannot create a new flag that is archived, but can update a flag to be archived.

custom_properties.description: List of nested blocks describing the feature flag's [custom properties](https://docs.launchdarkly.com/home/connecting/custom-properties)

defaults.description: A block containing the indices of the variations to be used as the default on and off variations in all new environments. Flag configurations in existing environments will not be changed nor updated if the configuration block is removed.

include_in_snippet.description: Specifies whether this flag should be made available to the client-side JavaScript SDK using the client-side Id. This value gets its default from your project configuration if not set. `include_in_snippet` is now deprecated. Please migrate to `client_side_availability.using_environment_id` to maintain future compatibility.

key.description: The unique feature flag key that references the flag in your application code.

maintainer_id.description: The feature flag maintainer's 24 character alphanumeric team member ID. If not set, it will automatically be or stay set to the member ID associated with the API key used by your LaunchDarkly Terraform provider or the most recently-set maintainer.

name.description: The feature flag's human-readable name

temporary.description: Specifies whether the flag is a temporary flag.

variation_type.description: The uniform type for all variations. Can be either "boolean", "string", "number", or "json".

variations.description: An array of possible variations for the flag

block.description:
Provides a LaunchDarkly feature flag data source.

This data source allows you to retrieve feature flag information from your LaunchDarkly organization.

context_targets.description: The set of nested blocks describing the individual targets for non-user context kinds for each variation.

fallthrough.description: Nested block describing the default variation to serve if no `prerequisites`, `target`, or `rules` apply.

flag_id.description: The feature flag's unique `id` in the format `project_key/flag_key`.

off_variation.description: The index of the variation to serve if targeting is disabled.

on.description: Whether targeting is enabled. Defaults to `false` if not set.

prerequisites.description: List of nested blocks describing prerequisite feature flags rules.

targets.description: Set of nested blocks describing the individual user targets for each variation.

track_events.description: Whether to send event data back to LaunchDarkly. Defaults to `false` if not set.

block.description:
Provides a LaunchDarkly environment-specific feature flag data source.

This data source allows you to retrieve environment-specific feature flag information from your LaunchDarkly organization.

enabled.description: Whether the trigger is currently active or not. This property defaults to true upon creation

flag_key.description: The key of the feature flag the trigger acts upon

id.description: The flag trigger resource ID. This can be found on your trigger URL - please see docs for more info

integration_key.description: The unique identifier of the integration you intend to set your trigger up with. "generic-trigger" should be used for integrations not explicitly supported.

maintainer_id.description: The LaunchDarkly ID of the member who maintains the trigger. The API will automatically apply the member associated with your Terraform API key or the most recently-set maintainer

kind.description: The action to perform when triggering. Currently supported flag actions are "turnFlagOn" and "turnFlagOff".

block.description: Instructions containing the action to perform when triggering. Currently supported flag actions are "turnFlagOn" and "turnFlagOff".

description.description: A short description of what the metric will be used for

event_key.description: The event key for your metric (if custom metric)

key.description: A unique key that will be used to reference the metric in your code

kind.description: The metric type -available choices are 'pageview', 'click', and 'custom'

maintainer_id.description: The LaunchDarkly ID of the user who will maintain the metric. If not set, the API will automatically apply the member associated with your Terraform API key or the most recently-set maintainer

name.description: A human-readable name for your metric

randomization_units.description: A set of one or more context kinds that this metric can measure events from.

selector.description: The CSS selector for your metric (if click metric)

success_criteria.description: The success criteria for your metric (if numeric metric)

unit.description: The unit for your metric (if numeric metric)

kind.description: The url type - available choices are 'exact', 'canonical', 'substring' and 'regex'

block.description: List of nested `url` blocks describing URLs that you want to track the metric on

display_key.description: The last four characters of the full_key.

id.description: The Relay Proxy configuration's unique 24 character ID

name.description: A human-friendly name for the Relay Proxy configuration

creation_date.description: The segment's creation date represented as a UNIX epoch timestamp.

description.description: The description of the segment's purpose.

excluded.description: List of user keys excluded from the segment. To target on other context kinds, use the excluded_contexts block attribute. This attribute is not valid when `unbounded` is set to `true`.

excluded_contexts.description: List of non-user target objects excluded from the segment. This attribute is not valid when `unbounded` is set to `true`.

included.description: List of user keys included in the segment. To target on other context kinds, use the included_contexts block attribute. This attribute is not valid when `unbounded` is set to `true`.

included_contexts.description: List of non-user target objects included in the segment. This attribute is not valid when `unbounded` is set to `true`.

key.description: The unique key that references the segment.

name.description: The human-friendly name for the segment.

rules.description: List of nested custom rule blocks to apply to the segment. This attribute is not valid when `unbounded` is set to `true`.

unbounded.description: Whether to create a standard segment (`false`) or a Big Segment (`true`). Standard segments include rule-based and smaller list-based segments. Big Segments include larger list-based segments and synced segments. Only use a Big Segment if you need to add more than 15,000 individual targets. It is not possible to manage the list of targeted contexts for Big Segments with Terraform.

unbounded_context_kind.description: For Big Segments, the targeted context kind. If this attribute is not specified it will default to `user`.

block.description:
Provides a LaunchDarkly segment data source.

This data source allows you to retrieve segment information from your LaunchDarkly organization.

custom_role_keys.description: A list of keys for custom roles the team has

maintainers.description: A list of maintainers as 'member' objects

name.description: The team's human-readable name

project_keys.description: A list of keys of projects that this team owns

name.description: A human-readable name for your webhook

secret.description: If sign is true, and the secret attribute is omitted, LaunchDarkly will automatically generate a secret for you
